subsc: Central government administration,General public administration sector

abstracts.cdata!:
The Ecuador Institutional Reform Project
            aims to make customs, procurement, civil service, and
            selected services more efficient, effective, transparent,
            and accountable. Reformed areas constitute models of state
            modernization to be expanded to other public sector areas.
            There are five project components. Component 1,Customs
            Reform, enhances efficiency and transparency of customs by
            improving service-delivery for users and strengthening
            collection, inspection and compliance. Component 2,
            Procurement Reform, expands access and enhances
            transparency, efficiency and competitiveness in procurement.
            Component 3, Professional Civil Service Management, enhances
            efficiency and transparency in the management of the civil
            service by developing the capacity of central government to
            monitor and manage the number, skills, remuneration and
            professionalism of its employees. Component 4, Efficiency
            and Accountability in Selected Public Agencies, improves
            efficiency and simplifies service provision and management
            in selected agencies. To select these agencies, particular
            eligibility criteria, including fiscal, social, management
            and efficiency indicators, will be specified in advance.
            Component 5, Change Management, creates the conditions
            necessary for successful implementation and sustainability
            of the project.
